name: asymmetrically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in such a way that two halves, sides, or parts of something are not exactly the same in shape or size: Her hair is cut asymmetrically so it hangs longer on the right side of her face. Chairs were arranged asymmetrically in rows to each side of an off-centre aisle. See
asymmetric
More examplesFewer examplesI like the look of the building and its asymmetrically placed windows. The car’s rear seat is split in two asymmetrically and one or both sides can be folded down. My understanding is that the two halves of the brain asymmetrically process both music and language.
